arts.ttl: The lowdown on Charlton 2 Lincoln City 2 - Tyreece Campbell and Lloyd Jones missed as League One top two dreams ended
arts.sum: Charlton: Mannion, Small (Ahadme 90), Ramsay, McIntyre (Mitchell 53), Gillesphey, Edwards, Docherty (Gilbert 90), Coventry, Anderson (Aneke 46), Berry (Dixon 52), Godden. Campbell has felt like an integral part of this Addicks side, especially as the season has gone on, and this match only underlined his importance.

arts.ttl: Charlton come from two down to deny Lincoln and maintain unbeaten home run
Claus Jensen: Charlton Athletic was the best part of my career
arts.sum: “We finished in the highest position that year, which was seventh, and I still think it was a great achievement by the team,” said Jensen. Jensen is at a loss to explain why Charlton had a pattern of seasons fizzling out – despite finishes that are now only dreamed about with the South Londoners looking to end a five-year stay in League One.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic striker Miles Leaburn to miss rest of League One campaign
arts.sum: Asked about his season, Charlton manager Nathan Jones said: “It has been a productive one because it was probably more productive than last year. Asked about whether he faces another summer of extensive rehab, Jones said: “It won’t necessarily be the same because the gravity of this injury is nowhere near the previous one.
